intro: Aitopsis foliosa, commonly known as the leafy aitopsis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Aitopsis foliosa is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
